alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 6:24PM EDT until March 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT TO 7 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 1/2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...From midnight Monday night to 7 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas with the late Monday Night/early Tuesday AM high tide. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...2 to 4 ft breaking waves will result in beach erosion and flooding, particularly Orient Point. Waves splashing over bulkheads and seawalls may locally exacerbate flooding of vulnerable shoreline roadways and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain during the times of high tide will likely exacerbate street flooding in coastal communities. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/04 AM 5.0/ 5.5 1.6/ 2.0 1.8/ 2.2 0 NONE 13/05 PM 4.2/ 4.7 0.9/ 1.4 1.8/ 2.2 1 NONE 14/06 AM 6.0/ 6.5 2.6/ 3.1 2.7/ 3.2 1-2 MIN-MOD 14/06 PM 4.4/ 4.9 1.0/ 1.5 2.0/ 2.5 1-2 NONE 15/07 AM 4.2/ 4.7 0.9/ 1.4 1.0/ 1.5 2 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/03 AM 4.0/ 4.5 1.0/ 1.5 1.2/ 1.7 0 NONE 13/03 PM 3.1/ 3.6 0.1/ 0.6 1.1/ 1.6 1 NONE 14/04 AM 4.7/ 5.2 1.8/ 2.2 2.1/ 2.6 3-5 MINOR 14/03 PM 3.6/ 4.1 0.6/ 1.1 1.8/ 2.2 1 NONE 15/05 AM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.8 0.6/ 1.1 2 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.3 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/04 AM 8.5/ 9.0 1.2/ 1.7 1.6/ 2.0 0-1 NONE 13/04 PM 7.7/ 8.2 0.4/ 0.9 1.6/ 2.0 1-2 NONE 14/05 AM 9.8/10.3 2.5/ 3.0 3.0/ 3.5 2-4 MINOR 14/05 PM 7.8/ 8.3 0.5/ 1.0 1.9/ 2.3 3-4 NONE 15/06 AM 7.5/ 8.0 0.2/ 0.7 0.8/ 1.3 3 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
